intro: Wahlenbergia marginata, commonly known as the coastal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in coastal regions, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers that attract various pollinators. Wahlenbergia marginata is often found in coastal dunes and is adapted to withstand salt spray and strong winds.
